stackBasic.name: Basic Stack Viewport Usage
stackBasic.description: Displays a single image in a Stack Viewport.

stackAPI.name: Stack Viewport API
stackAPI.description: Demonstrates how to interact with a Stack viewport (e.g. Set VOI Range, Next/Previous Images, Flip H/V, Rotate, Invert, Zoom/Pan, Reset)

stackVoiSigmoid.name: Stack Sigmoid LUT
stackVoiSigmoid.description: Demonstrates the Sigmoid LUT Function instead of Linear

stackEvents.name: Stack Viewport Events
stackEvents.description: Demonstrates the Events that are fired during interaction with a Stack Viewport

stackCanvasToWorld.name: Stack Viewport Canvas-to-World
stackCanvasToWorld.description: Demonstrates how to obtain the coordinates in the 3D world from a coordinate on the canvas.

volumeBasic.name: Basic Volume Viewport Usage
volumeBasic.description: Displays a set of DICOM images in a Volume Viewport.

volumeAPI.name: Volume Viewport API
volumeAPI.description: Demonstrates how to interact with a Volume viewport  (e.g. Set VOI Range, Change Camera Position / Orientation, Change Slab Thickness, Flip H/V, Rotate, Invert, Zoom/Pan, Reset)

volumeVoiSigmoid.name: Volume Sigmoid LUT
volumeVoiSigmoid.description: Demonstrates the Sigmoid LUT Function instead of Linear

volumeViewport3D.name: 3D Volume Rendering
volumeViewport3D.description: Demonstrates how to 3D render a volume and apply a preset

volumeEvents.name: Volume Viewport Events
volumeEvents.description: Demonstrates the Events that are fired during interaction with a Volume Viewport

multiVolumeAPI.name: Multiple Volumes in a Volume Viewport
multiVolumeAPI.description: Demonstrates how to interact with a Volume viewport when using multiple volumes (e.g. for PET/CT fusion).

multiVolumeCanvasToWorld.name: Multiple Volume Canvas-to-World
multiVolumeCanvasToWorld.description: Demonstrates how to use the canvasToWorld API to find the intensity value of each volume on mouse hover

polyDataActorAPI.name: Poly Data Actor in a Volume Viewport
polyDataActorAPI.description: Demonstrates how to render poly data with a Volume viewport

wadouri.name: Legacy DICOMweb (WADO-URI) Support
wadouri.description: Demonstrates how to support retrieval of entire Part 10 DICOM files directly via URL

volumeBasicWadoUri.name: Basic Volume using streaming WADOURI
volumeBasicWadoUri.description: Demonstrates how to displays a DICOM series (via URL) in a Volume viewport

webLoader.name: Load Web images of PNG or JPG format
webLoader.description: Demonstrates how render web images in a stack viewport

dynamicCINETool.name: Load a dynamic 4D data
dynamicCINETool.description: Demonstrates how you can render 4D data with cornerstone 3d

renderToCanvas.name: Render To Canvas
renderToCanvas.description: Demonstrates how to use the api to render to a canvas directly

changeColorMap.name: Change the colormap and adjusting the opacity
changeColorMap.description: Demonstrate how to interact with a fusion viewport, specifically by changing the colormap and adjusting the opacity.

volumePriorityLoading.name: Prioritizing Slices during Volume Loading
volumePriorityLoading.description: Demonstrates how to customize the slice loading order using the streaming-image volume loader

programaticPanZoom.name: Programmatic Pan/Zoom
programaticPanZoom.description: Demonstrates how to programmatically pan/zoom a stack viewport. It can be used for setting initial display area and presentation state.

local.name: DICOM P10 from the local file system
local.description: Provides an interface to load a DICOM P10 image from your local file system to the Cornerstone3D

localCPU.name: DICOM P10 from the local file system using CPU
localCPU.description: Cornerstone3D uses WebGL for rendering by default (if available) and a fallback to CPU. This example force rendering on CPU for debugging purposes.

stackProperties.name: Stack viewport default properties
stackProperties.description: Demonstrates how you can set per image properties for a stack viewport that acts as default values for that specific image

multipleToolGroups.name: Multiple Tool Groups
multipleToolGroups.description: Demonstrates the usage of multiple tool groups for a set of viewports.

stackManipulationTools.name: Stack Manipulation Tools
stackManipulationTools.description: Demonstrates several manipulation tools (window/level, pan, zoom) as well as Stack Viewport-specific scrolling

stackManipulationToolsTouch.name: Stack Manipulation Tools Touch
stackManipulationToolsTouch.description: Demonstrates several manipulation tools (window/level, pan, zoom) as well as Stack Viewport-specific scrolling for mobile touch

annotationToolModes.name: Annotation Tool Modes
annotationToolModes.description: Demonstrates the various tool modes for annotation tools (active, passive, enabled, disabled)

stackAnnotationTools.name: Stack Annotation Tools
stackAnnotationTools.description: Demonstrates usage of various annotation tools (Probe, Rectangle ROI, Elliptical ROI, Bidirectional measurements) on a Stack Viewport.

calibrationTools.name: Calibration Tools
calibrationTools.description: Demonstrates usage of calibration tools on a Stack Viewport.

volumeAnnotationTools.name: Volume Annotation Tools
volumeAnnotationTools.description: Demonstrates annotation using the Length tool in a Volume Viewport (on axial, sagittal, and oblique views)

annotationSelectionAndLocking.name: Annotation Selection and Locking
annotationSelectionAndLocking.description: Demonstrates how to toggle the Locked and Selected states for Annotations

resetCamera.name: Viewports Reset Camera
resetCamera.description: Demonstrates various options that are available for resetting camera on viewports

annotationVisibility.name: Annotation changing visibility
annotationVisibility.description: Demonstrates how to toggle the Visibility state for Annotations

modifierKeys.name: Binding Tools with Modifier Keys
modifierKeys.description: Demonstrates how to bind a tool to a keyboard and mouse combination (e.g. shift+click, ctrl+click)

magnifyTool.name: Magnify Tool
magnifyTool.description: Demonstrates the usage of the magnification tool

advancedMagnifyTool.name: Advanced Magnify Tool
advancedMagnifyTool.description: Demonstrates the usage of the advanced magnification tool on stack and volume viewports

CINETool.name: CINE Tool
CINETool.description: Demonstrates the usage of the CINE tool

planarFreehandROITool.name: Freehand ROI Tool
planarFreehandROITool.description: Demonstrates drawing of both open and closed freehand ROIs (contour tool) on stack and volume viewports

polyDataActorManipulationTools.name: Manipulation Tools with Poly Data in a Volume Viewport API
polyDataActorManipulationTools.description: Demonstrates how to interact with a Volume viewport (Pan, Zoom, Rotate) by mouse events

volumeViewportOrientation.name: Volume Viewport Orientation
volumeViewportOrientation.description: Demonstrates you can switch between different orientation of a volume viewport

referenceCursors.name: Referencing Cursors
referenceCursors.description: Demonstrates how to synchronize the cursor between multiple viewports

doubleClickWithStackAnnotationTools.name: Double Click With Stack Annotation Tools
doubleClickWithStackAnnotationTools.description: Demonstrates double click detection before/during/after using various annotation tools on a stack viewport.

dynamicPetCt.name: Load a petCT data where PT series is 4D
dynamicPetCt.description: Demonstrates how to render a 4D data into multiple viewports and fuse them

labelmapRendering.name: Labelmap Segmentation Rendering
labelmapRendering.description: Demonstrates how to add a Labelmap to the viewports for rendering

contourRendering.name: Contour Segmentation Representation
contourRendering.description: Demonstrates how to use the Contour Segmentation Representation

surfaceRendering.name: Surface Segmentation Representation
surfaceRendering.description: Demonstrates how to use the Surface Segmentation Representation

surfaceRenderingStack.name: Surface Segmentation on Stack Viewport and Volume Viewports
surfaceRenderingStack.description: Demonstrates how to render surface intersections with stack and volume viewports

labelmapSwapping.name: Labelmap Segmentation Swapping
labelmapSwapping.description: Demonstrate how to display segmentations on a volume viewport, and swap which segmentation is being displayed

labelmapGlobalConfiguration.name: Global Labelmap Segmentation Configuration
labelmapGlobalConfiguration.description: Demonstrates how to set a global configuration for segmentation representations

contourRenderingConfiguration.name: Contour rendering configuration
contourRenderingConfiguration.description: Demonstrates how to set a configuration (such as line thickness) for contour rendering

labelmapToolGroupSpecificConfiguration.name: ToolGroup Specific Labelmap Segmentation Configuration
labelmapToolGroupSpecificConfiguration.description: Demonstrate how to change the configuration of how a specific tool group displays segmentations through via segmentation representations

labelmapSegmentSpecificConfiguration.name: Labelmap segment-specific Configuration
labelmapSegmentSpecificConfiguration.description: Demonstrates how to change the configuration of a specific segment

labelmapSegmentationTools.name: Segmentation Tools (Labelmap) - Brush, Scissors
labelmapSegmentationTools.description: Demonstrates how to use manual segmentation tools to modify the segmentation data

labelmapSegmentLocking.name: Labelmap Segmentation Swapping
labelmapSegmentLocking.description: Demonstrate how a segment can be locked such that it cannot be edited by segmentation tools

labelmapRenderingDifferentResolutions.name: Rendering Labelmap with Different Resolutions
labelmapRenderingDifferentResolutions.description: Demonstrates that the segmentation resolution need not to be the same as the source data

rectangleROIThreshold.name: Rectangle ROI Threshold Segmentation
rectangleROIThreshold.description: Demonstrates how to use the rectangle roi tool to perform threshold segmentation

mipJumpToClick.name: Maximum Intensity Projection (MIP) - Jump to Click
mipJumpToClick.description: Demonstrates how to obtain the location of the maximum value along the ray in a MIP view, and then navigate another set of viewports to this location.

crossHairs.name: Crosshairs
crossHairs.description: Here we demonstrate crosshairs linking three orthogonal views of the same data

overlayGrid.name: Overlay Grid
overlayGrid.description: Demonstrate overlay grid tool usage with three viewports one for each orientation

referenceLines.name: Reference Lines
referenceLines.description: Demonstrate reference line tool for rendering viewports location with respect to each other

orientationMarker.name: Orientation Marker
orientationMarker.description: Demonstrate orientation marker tool for viewports orientation it has cube, axis and custom actors

petCT.name: PET-CT Fusion + MIPLayout
petCT.description: PT-CT fusion layout with Crosshairs, and synchronized cameras, CT W/L and PET threshold

sharedToolState.name: Shared Tool State
sharedToolState.description: Demonstrates that annotations are stored on frame of reference, and can therefore be shared between Stack and Volume Viewports.

stackToVolumeWithAnnotations.name: StackViewport <--> VolumeViewport
stackToVolumeWithAnnotations.description: Demonstrates how annotations are preserved and rendered correctly even when a stack viewport is converted to a volume viewport and vice versa. This is an advanced usage for MPR

volumeViewportSynchronization.name: Volume Viewport Synchronization
volumeViewportSynchronization.description: Demonstrates how to set up synchronization between viewports for viewport-level (e.g. camera) and actor-level (e.g. VOI) properties.

cancelAnnotationDrawing.name: Cancel Annotation Drawing
cancelAnnotationDrawing.description: Demonstrates how to use the keyboard (ESC) key to cancel annotation drawing.

scaleOverlayTool.name: Scale Overlay Tool
scaleOverlayTool.description: Demonstrates the scale overlay tool for rendering a scale on a viewport showing the real world size of the image.

generateImageFromTimeData.name: Generate 3D Volume From 4D Data
generateImageFromTimeData.description: Demostrates generating a 3D volume from 4D data using subtract, average or sum.

dicomImageLoaderWADOURI.name: WADO-URI (DICOM P10)
dicomImageLoaderWADOURI.description: WADO-URI (DICOM P10 via HTTP GET) with different codecs

segmentationExport.name: DICOM SEG export
segmentationExport.description: Demonstrates how to export a segmentation to DICOM SEG

niftiBasic.name: Load Nifti Volume
niftiBasic.description: Demonstrates how to load and render a nifti volume

niftiWithTools.name: Tool Usage in Nifti
niftiWithTools.description: Demonstrates how to use manipulation and annotation tools on a nifti volume
